Definition: Two analogies that signify affordances is given in the form "A : B. C : ?". "A : B" implies that B is an affordance of A. Your task is to replace the question mark (?) with the appropriate affordance of the given action C, following the "A : B" relation.

Positive Examples.explanation: The given analogy implies that diseases can be cured - an affordance relation. Hence, the appropriate answer for swing is sword, since swords can be swung.
The given analogy implies that books can be written - an affordance relation. Hence, the appropriate answer for swear is oath, since oaths can be sworn.
The given analogy implies that songs can be sung - an affordance relation. Hence, the appropriate answer for drive is car, since cars can be driven.

Negative Examples.explanation: The given analogy implies that horses can be ridden - an affordance relation. But, car is not an appropriate answer for attack, since cars cannot be attacked.
The given analogy implies that oaths can be sworn - an affordance relation. But, fall is not an appropriate answer for drop, since this models the causation relation.
The given analogy implies that water can be drunk - an affordance relation. But, enemy is not an appropriate answer for give
